episodeTitleJapanese: Hotobashiru Zangeki! Zoro tai Shinkan Ōmu!!
episodeTitleRomanized: Hotobashiru Zangeki! Zoro tai Shinkan Ōmu!!
description: Zoro defeats Priest Ohm using his powerful new 108 Pound Cannon technique. Meanwhile, Pagaya and Conis learn the horrifying truth about Enel's plan to destroy all of Skypiea and its inhabitants.

events.title: Zoro vs. Ohm Battle Continues
events.description: Zoro continues his intense battle against Priest Ohm, facing the deadly Ordeal of Iron. Ohm's Iron Cloud sword can change shape at will, making him a formidable opponent with his Mantra abilities.
events.significance: This battle showcases Zoro's growth as a swordsman and his ability to overcome opponents with observation haki-like abilities.

events.title: Ohm's Iron Cloud Techniques
events.description: Ohm demonstrates his various Iron Cloud sword techniques including Eisen Whip, Eisen Back (defensive wall), Eisen Fan, Eisen Fork, and Eisen Fleuret. His Eisen Dial allows him to create iron-hard cloud that can change shape instantly.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Ohm's combat capabilities and the versatility of the Iron Cloud weapon system.

quotes.text: My Iron Cloud can take any shape I desire!
quotes.speaker: Ohm

events.title: Zoro's 108 Pound Cannon Debut
events.description: Zoro unleashes his new technique, the 108 Pound Cannon (Hyaku Hachi Pound Ho), a powerful flying slash attack. This is an evolution of his 36 and 72 Pound Cannon techniques, demonstrating his mastery of Santoryu.
events.significance: Marks a significant milestone in Zoro's development as a swordsman, showing his ability to create more powerful ranged attacks. This technique becomes one of his signature moves.

quotes.text: Santoryu: Hyaku Hachi Pound Ho! (Three Sword Style: 108 Pound Cannon!)
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's declaration as he unleashes his new technique for the first time

events.title: Zoro Defeats Ohm
events.description: Using his 108 Pound Cannon technique, Zoro successfully defeats Priest Ohm, one of Enel's most powerful subordinates. The powerful flying slash attack overcomes Ohm's Iron Cloud defense and Mantra abilities.
events.significance: Eliminates one of the four priests and proves Zoro's growth. The Ordeal of Iron, which had a 0% survival rate, is finally conquered.

events.title: Enel's Plan Revealed to Pagaya and Conis
events.description: An injured royal guard reveals to Pagaya and Conis that Enel plans to destroy all of Skypiea and its inhabitants. Enel intends to use the Ark Maxim to escape to 'Fairy Vearth' (the moon) while annihilating everyone in the sky.
events.significance: This revelation exposes the true scope of Enel's genocidal intentions and raises the stakes dramatically. It shows that Enel views the existence of people in the sky as unnatural.

quotes.text: Enel is planning to destroy all of Skypiea and everyone in it!
quotes.speaker: Royal Guard
quotes.context: Revealing Enel's catastrophic plan to Pagaya and Conis

events.title: Pagaya's Sacrifice
events.description: After learning of Enel's plan, Pagaya pushes Conis out of the way as Enel strikes them with a lightning bolt. Pagaya takes the full force of the attack to protect his daughter.
events.significance: Demonstrates Pagaya's love for his daughter and willingness to sacrifice himself. This moment shows the personal cost of Enel's tyranny.

events.title: Wyper Attempts to Rescue Aisa
events.description: Wyper fires his Burn Bazooka at the giant snake Nola in an attempt to rescue Aisa, who has been swallowed. This shows Wyper's protective nature toward his people despite his harsh exterior.
events.significance: Reveals Wyper's character depth and his commitment to protecting the Shandia people, especially the children.

events.title: Luffy Protects Companions Inside Nola
events.description: Luffy, Nami, and Gan Fall are shown inside the giant snake Nola. Despite being in danger, Luffy works to protect his companions and find a way out.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's dedication to his crew even in the most dire circumstances.

events.title: Ark Maxim Mentioned
events.description: The royal guard mentions Enel's Ark Maxim, the massive flying ship that Enel will use to escape Skypiea and travel to the moon after destroying the island.
events.significance: First mention of the Ark Maxim to civilians, foreshadowing the climactic final phase of the Skypiea arc.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro unleashes his 108 Pound Cannon for the first time

quotes.text: Enel is planning to destroy all of Skypiea and everyone in it!
quotes.speaker: Royal Guard

themes.description: Zoro's development of the 108 Pound Cannon demonstrates his continuous growth as a swordsman and his dedication to mastering new techniques.
themes.symbolism: The progression from 36 to 72 to 108 Pound Cannon represents Zoro's journey and escalating power.

culturalReferences.reference: The number 108 holds significance in Buddhism, representing the number of earthly temptations one must overcome to reach enlightenment

themes.description: The episode explores the cost of Enel's tyranny through Pagaya's sacrifice to protect Conis and the revelation of Enel's genocidal plan.
themes.symbolism: Enel's god complex and willingness to destroy entire populations reflects themes of absolute power and corruption.

themes.description: Zoro overcomes the Ordeal of Iron (0% survival rate) and Wyper continues fighting to protect his people despite overwhelming opposition.
themes.symbolism: The Ordeal of Iron represents seemingly insurmountable challenges that can be overcome with skill and willpower.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates significant growth by defeating Ohm and debuting the 108 Pound Cannon technique, showing his evolution as a swordsman.
keyActions: Defeats Ohm and survives the Ordeal of Iron

characterSpotlights.development: Ohm's defeat marks the fall of one of Enel's four priests and shows the limits of the Ordeal of Iron.
Pagaya shows his love for his daughter by sacrificing himself to protect her from Enel's lightning attack.
keyActions: Learns of Enel's plan to destroy Skypiea
Takes the full force of Enel's lightning attack

mangaDifferences.difference: The scene depicting Luffy, Nami, and Gan Fall inside Nola with Aisa threatening them was anime-original content not present in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of Zoro's 108 Pound Cannon technique, which becomes one of his signature moves throughout the series.
The number 108 in Buddhism represents the number of earthly desires or temptations that a person must overcome to reach enlightenment, adding spiritual significance to Zoro's technique name.
Ohm's Ordeal of Iron had a 0% survival rate, making Zoro the first person to successfully complete it.
This episode adapts manga chapters 271 (pages 9-18) and 272 (pages 5-13).
Episode 178 received an IMDb rating of 8.3 out of 10, higher than the series average.

sources.title: One Piece - Hotobashiru Zangeki! Zoro VS Shinkan Ohm!! (TV Episode 2004)
